result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charton T. McKnight

defendant.name: McKnight, Charton T.
defendant.address: 38455 N. Sheridan Road Lot 740, Beach Park, IL 60087

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Jensen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, this case is dismissed and read in for sentencing in 12CF769.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Jensen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Jensen stipulates to the Dr's report.  Court finds that the deft is competent to proceed.  Atty Jensen states he believes they are close to resolution; waives preliminary hearing.  Deft waives preliminary hearing.  State files information.  Atty Jensen acknowledges receipt and waives reading, enters not guilty plea.  FPT set for 1/23/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Jensen the FP of 12/8/14 at 8:15am is rescheduled, as the competency report will not be completed by that date; reset to 12/17/14 at 2:30pm.
for Competency Examination by DHS  kmk

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Dirk Jensen. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Jensen raises issue of competency and requests competency evaluation be ordered. Court orders competency evaluation under 971.13 to be performed in-patient. Report to be filed in 15 days. Competency hearing on 12-8-14 @ 8:15. Bond continued.

114pm  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 11/19/14 @ 845am.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
